decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The use of the building for purposes falling within Class C3 (Dwellinghouses) of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) must be begun not later than three years from the date of this decision.  

Reason: In order to comply with Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications:  P10 Received:  05 July 2024,  P11 (Rev A), P200 (Rev A), P201 (Rev B), P202 (Rev C) Received:  01 July 2024.  

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.

Reason: In order to protect the free flow and safety of traffic on nearby highways and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 4 - The two second floor dwellinghouses hereby approved are to remain in use as dwellinghouses within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.  

Reason: To accord with the provisions of Paragraph MA.2 (6) of Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding any inconsistencies with the internal layout of the building's two second floor dwellinghouses hereby approved and secured by Condition 2 in accordance with the approved proposed drawings, the building's two second floor dwellinghouses hereby approved shall not be occupied until the installation of seven cycle parking racks (with an associated awning and rear stairwell cycle access ramp) within the building's second floor rear terrace and an additional second floor rear door, as previously granted by and in accordance with the approved proposed drawings of Planning Permission P/2024/2185, has been completed.  

The cycle parking racks, awning and access ramp previously granted by Planning Permission P/2024/2185 shall be maintained in a good condition and be permanently retained as such.  

Reason: In the interests of future occupiers by providing adequate residential accommodation and cycle parking facilities, in accordance with the provisions of Paragraph MA.2 (2) (a) of Part 3, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
description: Prior Approval for the change of use of the building's existing second floor offices (Use Class E) to two flats (Use Class C3)
